intro: Vigna radiata var. sublobata, commonly known as the cowpea or yardlong bean, is a leguminous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, elongated pods that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers, followed by edible seeds that are rich in protein. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm climate with adequate sunlight. Vigna radiata var. sublobata is often cultivated for its nutritional value and is used in various culinary traditions around the world.
